intro: Pogononeura biflora, commonly known as the two-flowered pogononeura, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. Its leaves are opposite and elliptical, with a smooth texture and a slightly serrated edge. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Pogononeura biflora is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
